titles.title: MP347 It may be at morn

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
It may be at morn, when the day is awaking,
when sunlight through darkness and shadow is breaking,
that Jesus will come in the fulness of glory,
to receive from the world 'His own'.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
It may be at mid-day, it may be at twilight,
it may be, perchance, that the blackness of midnight
will burst into light in the blaze of His glory,
when Jesus receives 'His own'

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
While hosts cry hosanna, from heaven descending,
with glorified saints and the angels attending,
with grace on His brow, like a halo of glory,
will Jesus receive 'His own'.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Oh, joy! Oh, delight! should we go without dying;
with glorified saints and the angels attending,
caught up through the clouds with our Lord into glory,
when Jesus receives 'His own'.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
O Lord Jesus, how long?
How long ere we shout the glad song?
Christ returneth,
hallelujah,
hallelujah, amen,
hallelujah, amen!
